column1:
Japanbuilder,"2016-02-18T10:23:34.473Z","Outstanding Ladder Truck","

This set is an excellent ladder truck with great design and play value.

Nothing fancy the standard instructions we have been accustomed to lately are included. The box depicts the firefighters going about their work riding their amazing truck! It is a ladder truck after all we all know what it does.

Nothing fancy very common pieces are included, however, I will note that this set does come with a couple of the new 1x1 round plate pieces with a hole in the center and those are precious. Already I skipped using them for the suggested portion and have them earmarked for some fancier stuff. Very useful pieces indeed. Too bad there are so few of those included.

I also took into account that stud shooter, I know some folk do not like them. I too usually keep those studs well away from my kids as they are very young and those are not safe to keep as loose pieces.
The rest is very common. There is also only one breathing aparatus
column2: included for our firefighters so one will have to swap out the role of actual fire fighting while the other coordinates/operates the ladder truck.

column1: 2 minifigures are included in this set and they are very good. The male comes with grime and dirt on his face and it looks pretty cool. Both feature very nice prints on their legs and torsos, though if you have a lot of firefighters they are not mind blowing. The torso print for the female appears new to me though. It has a print of a cool vertical handle flashlight on it which I like.

The build is simple since it is a city set, however, I will note if you have smaller children the initial few pages may get tricky as only one color differentiates one side from the other and as the build progresses it gets obscured and your young builder may get just a tad disoriented by that. It is not too bad but even I had to flip back a few pages to spot what was happening during the initial phases of the build.

The finished model is great! The ladder extends quite a way up and the string for the water hose reaches all the way up with it. The ladder section also rotates a full 360 degrees which is a nice function. The stickers make the set really pop as well I suggest adding them if you intend to keep the model as-is. The set also features plenty of external hooks for all the extra gear the firefighters will need and then some. There is also a small storage compartment on one side for even more stuff.
The cab section also allows for one firefighter to sit with his or her breathing aparatus
column2: on which is a welcome feature. No fumbling about through racks or storage crates to get at that gear. If you have lots of firefighters two more can hang to the outside of the truck via the safety bars. It is a nice nice set.&nbsp

column1: While I would love to gush over this set for a while I must confess that comparing it to the previous stand alone set (60002 I believe) it is not that different for the usual fare. If you already have a couple of the recent fire ladder trucks from city then this set has nothing more to add to your collection.
If like me this was your first, however, then embrace it. It is a very well put together and designed vehicle with a lot fo functionality for the job of dousing those flames!
